subject: What's on Inside Sport tonight
body:
BBC SPORT














BBC Daily E-mail
Other e-mail newsletters

















INSIDE SPORT PRESENTER GABBY LOGAN
Hello, Gabby here.


This week - is the relegation battle over or is the Premier League about to be taken to court?  


A growing number of clubs are unhappy about the way the Premier League dealt with the controversial transfer of Javier Mascherano and Carlos Tevez. 


They believe West Ham should have been docked points and want proof that Tevez was eligible to play.  


We'll be asking a top sports lawyer if results on the pitch could be overturned by verdicts in court.


And let me introduce you to the world of top England batsman, Kevin Pietersen.  


Gone are the blonde highlights and late nights.  


He is, as they say, a changed man.  


My interview with him is a fascinating watch. 


And we visit Los Angeles - the city is in a state of fevered expectation as the weeks tick away to the arrival of David Beckham.  


LA Galaxy say they've already made a lot of their money back - given Becks got a £125m deal, they need to really - but we found he might have a pretty hard time winning over the baseball and basketball fans.


All that AND the results of our competition to win a pair of tickets to Saturday's FA Cup final.


Don't miss it - tonight , BBC ONE, five past eleven.


Gabby hosts Inside Sport on Monday 14 May, 2305 BST on BBC ONE, and second edition, Sunday 20 May, 1130 BST on BBC TWO. 








THIS WEEK ON BBC SPORT
 All the TV and radio times
